result.execSummary:
The defendant Christian Cross Wagner was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Christian Cross Wagner is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Christian Cross Wagner was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "H" Felony], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Christian Cross Wagner was found guilty of Possession of Methamphetamine [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "I" Felony], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Court dismisses Counts 1, 2, 3, 4, 7, 8 and 9.
Court authorizes expungement upon successful completion of Probation as the Court defines it.
54 days credit against ultimate sentence.

 
In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

miscConds.notes:
Apply bond on file.
DNA surcharge.

-Defendant to successfully complete Drug Court and follow all rules and conditions.
-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
-Not to associate with any persons known or suspected to be involved in use, trafficking, dealing or manufacturing of illegal drugs except in a treatment setting.
-Random and regular testing.
-Defendant to submit a DNA sample.
-Defendant to finish his HS diploma.

supervisions.notes:
***AMENDED***
Per Judge Scott R. Needham May 8, 2018 - amend credit. 

-Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Substance Abuse Program.

-If a Wisconsin State Prison sentence is imposed, outstanding financial obligations shall be paid from all inmate money at a rate of 25% and the balance due as a condition of extended supervision. 

In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

superMiscConds.notes:
-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
-Not to associate with any persons known or suspected to be involved in use, trafficking, dealing or manufacturing of illegal drugs except in a treatment setting.
-Not to enter any business or establishment where the primary purpose is sale of alcohol.
-Defendant to complete his HSED.
-All costs earlier ordered will be paid during Extended Supervision.
AODA and follow any recommended treatment and any additional programming recommended by the Agent.

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson.ADA:   Edward Minser   DF ATTY:  Joseph Robert Caton   DF:  Christian Cross Wagner appeared from jail. Case called at 4:27. Includes 16CF229, 15CF339, 15CF344, 15CF457, 15CF511, 16CF11 and 16CF60. ADA Minser believes there is a resolution. Atty. Caton updates the court. ADA Miser gives reasons for his recommendations. Atty. Caton responds and provides the psychological evaluation to the court. Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads G to Ct 5 and 6 in 16CF60. DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 5 and 6 in 16CF60. On motion of the State without objecton, Crt dismisses with prejudice 16CF229, 15CF339, 15CF457, 15CF511, 16CF11, 15CF344 and Ct. 1,2,3,4,7,8,9 in 16CF60. Court reopens and dismisses 14TR4820, 14TR4821 and 16TR163. Sentencing arguments. DE makes statement. Crt orders: Sentence W/H

- 7 months St. Croix County Jail condition time

- Not to associate with any persons known or suspected to be involved in use, trafficking, dealing or manufacturing of illegal drugs except in a treatment setting.

Final pre-trial on April 28, 2016 at 08:30 am.

**AMENDED**

$250.00 additional cash to be payed.

 Includes 14TR4820, 14TR4821, 15CF339, 15CF344, 15CF457, 15CF511, 16CF11 and 16CF60.

__ SIGNATURE BOND:   _X_ Defendant and/or  __ Surety guarantees compliance with the terms of this bond by pledging $1000.00

- DE to provide proof of employment no later than 04-08-2016. If DE does not have a job DE must report   immediately to St. Croix County Jail.

- DE to maintain residence with grandmother Lois Wagner.

- DE to maintain a curfew of 9:00pm unless DE is working. 

- DE to participate in one NA or AA meeting a week and provide proof of attendance when he reports for testing on Saturdays.

- DE to report every Tues. and Sat. before 5:00pm for UA testing at St. Croix County Jail.  In front of a same sex officer at $5.00 per test.

- DE not to associate with any persons known or suspected to be involved in use, trafficking, dealing or manufacturing of illegal drugs except in a treatment setting.

-  Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
